field.name: summary
field.value: GenericPage doesn't behave gracefully when PageSize = 0

field.name: description

comment.author: gauthier
comment.text:
simplest option is to throw ArgumentOutOfRange, and document that in the constructor xml comments.
Discarding page size when 0 would not comply (IMHO) with the principle of least astonishment, and could be done in a applicative specific class if testing outside looks like a burden.
For the PageIndex idea, a look at IPaginatedPage interface documentation states "Indexes are zero based." and I think it would mess the code while using GenericPage<T> constructor
Aside the curPage constructor's argument is poorly named and should be renamed something like oneBasedPageIndex (or is it zeroBasedPageIndex?).

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text:
Gauthier, I agree that an ArgumentOutOfRange exception is the best option. This should be thrown if the PageSize is set to anything less than 1.
In regards to CurrentPage, if currentPage has the word "Index" eg. CurrentPageIndex than it should be 0 based but if it doesn't eg. CurrentPage than is should be 1 based. My reason for this logic is because in c# index based lists/arrays always start at 0 while the other one without "Index" should apply the common rules eg. books do not have a zero page.
Vincent, "the Pagination item is missing in the "Components" list when submitting an issue." we know that, and unfortunately the current version of Donjon has a bug that prevents us from adding new Components. We will add it when Donjon bug gets fixed. Thanks
Cheers John
